Description:
Detects the use of tail to extract bytes at an offset from an image and then decode the base64 value to create a new file with the decoded content. The detected execution is a bash one-liner.


Author: Joseliyo Sanchez, @Joseliyo_Jstnk
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Potential Base64 Decoded From Images
Query: sourcetype like 'macos-%' eql select * from _source_ where (process_path like '%/bash' and (command like '%tail%' and command like '%-c%') and (command like '%base64%' and command like '%-d%' and command like '%>%') and (command like '%.avif%' or command like '%.gif%' or command like '%.jfif%' or command like '%.jpeg%' or command like '%.jpg%' or command like '%.pjp%' or command like '%.pjpeg%' or command like '%.png%' or command like '%.svg%' or command like '%.webp%'))
